alert.note: Alert for Christian (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 12:06AM CDT until May 07 at 8:46PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Christian, Douglas, Greene, Lawrence, Stone, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1203 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches of rainfall possible overnight. - This includes the following low water crossings... Finley River at Johns Ford Road, Wilson`s Creek at Old Limey Road, Green Valley Creek at Holder RD, James River at Bell Ford Road and Little Crane Creek at Old Wire Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southeastern Springfield, Nixa, Ozark, Republic, Marshfield, Battlefield, Highlandville and Rogersville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
